title: Effective Mathematics Pedagogy Using Technology: Adaptive Learning Design Based on Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic smartphone operation skills
context.additional_context: Job-seeking individuals receive job-linked mathematics education with mobile device-based contextualized learning content. Strengthening practical problem-solving skills through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can solve three or more real-life math problems per week using mobile microlearning content based on intentional instructional design.
Learners can explain math concepts (e.g., statistics, functions) tailored to their learning pace and comprehension with over 80% accuracy through adaptive instruction.
Learners can complete project-based assignments (e.g., data analysis) with peers using digital collaboration tools and submit results as a portfolio.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Jamboard)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
